subject: Re: [junit] Re: HOW TO ASK QUESTIONS ON THIS GROUP - FAQ    proposal
msgSnippet: ... I agree - a static email message has a much greater chance of being read than a wiki page, as it gives the impression of being more official. A wiki would
messageBody:
At 04:49 PM 16/10/01, you wrote:
>I think there is a definite advantage to a static email being sent as the
>first message one receives on the list. A Wiki or similar is not a bad
>idea by itself, however. We could balance toward a short static fact which
>describes critical resources and refers immediately to a dynamic system.
>This would raise the chances of the FAQ remaining up to date.


I agree - a static email message has a much greater chance of being read
than a wiki page, as it gives the impression of being more official.


A wiki would be a good idea, but I was under the impression that one
already existed?





--

* Jim Cheesman *
